ASSIGNMENT.szTooltipText: Perform life-saving surgery on your wounded men, using state-of-the-art equipment.
Practice the art of medicine on local patients. If you're good at it, saving lives will help boost your approval ratings across the country. Just... try not to kill anybody!
Train other mercs in the art of medicine, with the help of local patients.

Study the art of medicine, with the help of local patients. More efficient than studying medicine in the field, but be careful not to catch a Health-reducing disease. Also, try not to kill anybody, ok?

Comfy hospital beds and plenty of medical equipment will help hasten the recovery of your wounded mercs. Of course, a hospital isn't the healthiest place to stay for a long time, what with all the sick people around.
Have a drink at the local bar! The locals might join in to carouse with you, though you may find yourself in a friendly fist-fight. It's all in a night's work.

Assign guards to operate this prison. Maintaining the semblence of law (or at least, punishment) will encourage Arulcans to stay on you good side. The locals won't like it though, and your guards might not enjoy it either. It is dangeruos work.
Your mercs can Interrogate prisoners of war here. Prisoners might join you cause, or give you helpful information.

By staffing the Harbor's head office, you can maximize the efficiency of mineral exports leaving the country. Your mine income will soar as a result! It's a good way to win the locals' trust, but the heavy machinery on the docks has its dangers.
Build up your muscles by loading cargo crates onto the ships. It's an honest work that'll make a few bucks, but watch out not to over-do it.

This airport's paperwork could use some optimizing. By paying a few extra workers, you can ship out some of your mine output to premium jewellers worldwide, increasing your revenues. The locals will appreciate the work you put in. Just remember - jet fumes aren't very good for your health.
Spend some time loading and unloading aircraft. Good for body-building, but watch out for work-related injuries.

The machinery here can manufacture all sorts of replacements parts, which will dramatically increase your efficiency at repair, as long as you're willing to pay for the metals. Of course, working in a stuffy and crowded factory can't possibly be good for you.

The machinery here can manufacture all sorts of replacements parts, which will dramatically increase your efficiency at repair, as long as you're willing to pay for the metals. Of course, working in a stuffy and crowded factory can't possibly be good for you.

The machinery here can manufacture all sorts of replacements parts, which will dramatically increase your efficiency at repair, as long as you're willing to pay for the metals. Of course, working in a stuffy and crowded factory can't possibly be good for you.
There are plenty of beds here. It's a bit basic, but certainly better than resting outside!

The war room here has all sorts of digital equipment, designed for maintaining a good grasp on the strategic situation across the country. This will help you coordinate your defenses, and collect information about enemy movements in the wilderness. You might even learn a thing or two.
This military facility was designed to aid train new officers.
Studying the art of leadership is much easier in an environment specifically designed for that purpose.
This is as good a place as any to train other men in gunnery. Just try to stay out of the line of fire.
With pop-up targets and shooting booths, this is the best place around for studying the fine art of marksmanship. Of course, gun safety is a hard thing to master.
Why not spend some time practicing your aim? The dummy targets are practically begging for it. It sure as hell beats taking pot-shots at rocks out in the wilderness.

The locals here may be willing to scout out the surrounding area for you. You can collect the information gleaned from them to get a better idea about enemy activity in this region. They'll feel safer, and you might even learn a few things about strategic coordination.
By manning this facility, you can ensure that the sky above you remains clear of enemy aircraft. Any friendlies flying up there will feel a whole lot safer for it...
The head miner is looking for assistants to help coordinate the mining efforts. This will definitely increase output from this mine. Just remember that mine work isn't very safe, nor very healthy.
Anyone who knows how to set explosives will be welcome in a mine. It's a good opportunity to learn the trade. Assuming, of course, that you can manage to avoid blowing yourself up.
Hoo-boy! Lemme at those ladies!
A solemn hour of prayer and devotion in a quiet little church can help raise anyone's spirit. It might also convince the locals that you respect their way of life.
Have a drink at the bar! Maybe start a few fights, too. Great for morale, but the people of Arulco will be hard-pressed to see you as a positive role-model...

There's plenty of gymnastic equipment here, just waiting to be used. This is a great way to get a balanced work-out that might improve your shape considerably. Just remember: there is a thing as too much workout.

Know something about fine art? Maybe you can work as a guide at this museum. The locals will certainly appreciate it, and there's no better place to gain a little cultural education. Please try not to break anything.
A visit to the museum can be very relaxing, and there's always a chance you'd actually learn something. If you break anything though, no one is going to be pleased.

This laboratory has some of the most high-tech equipment you've ever seen! This is a great place to run some wacky experiments on all sorts of subjects. Of course, working with caustic and volatile chemicals carries a risk.
A true scientist is keen to pass on his knowledge. Why not try educating some of your fellow mercs in the various sciences? Try to stay out of the way when they mix the water with the lithium.
Experimentation is the best way to learn science, and this place is equipped for some serious experimentation. Hey, I wonder what happens when you mix Sulfuric Acis and Nitric Acid?

This place is practically littered with spare parts for anything you might imagine. This will certainly make any repair-work considerably easier. Then again, tripping over a big sharp piece of metal can be detrimental to your health.

This place is practically littered with spare parts for anything you might imagine. This will certainly make any repair-work considerably easier. Then again, tripping over a big sharp piece of metal can be detrimental to your health.

This place is practically littered with spare parts for anything you might imagine. This will certainly make any repair-work considerably easier. Then again, tripping over a big sharp piece of metal can be detrimental to your health.

Sun, sand, surf. This sure as hell beats sleeping in a trench. Of course, the people of Arulco are not going to like the fact that you're resting at a beach resort instead of fighting for their freedom.

Say you're wounded. Would you rather be receiving medical treatment while lying in a pool of mud, or while lying on a comfy beach recliner? Just watch it, the people of Arulco are probably going to assume that you're just goofing off at their expense.
Running up and down the beach, taking a long swim, soaking in the sun... it makes you feel alive!
A beach is as good a place as any to give your men some physical excercise. It's good for them. Now drop and give me twenty, and then run and get me a banana daiquiri.
If you're going to haul-ass, wouldn't you rather do it on a nice, sunny beach?
This motel offers a few quiet rooms, clean beds, and a health local breakfast.
A clean bed and a hearty meal / will soon help your mercs to heal.
Your mercs can Interrogate prisoners of war here. Prisoners might join you cause, or give you helpful information.
Your mercs can Interrogate prisoners of war here. Prisoners might join you cause, or give you helpful information.
There are plenty of beds here. It's a bit basic, but certainly better than resting outside!
Repairing your equipment in a workshop is much more convenient than doing it in the field.
After winning their trust, some of the locals are willing to offer you their hospitality. It might be a bit basic, but it sure is better than sleeping on the barren ground.
A clean bed and a hearty meal / will soon help your mercs to heal.
These nice homes seem to be abandoned. Hmmmmm.... comfortable beds.
A clean bed and a hearty meal / will soon help your mercs to heal.
This abandoned mine is the perfect place to train your explosive skills.

By manning this facility, you can ensure that the sky above you remains clear of enemy aircraft. Any friendlies flying up there will feel a whole lot safer for it... Though it's quite hot in the desert.
There are plenty of beds here. It's a bit basic, but certainly better than resting outside. Though it's quite hot in the desert.
Repairing your equipment in a workshop is much more convenient than doing it in the field. Though it's quite hot in the desert.
There are still a few beds here. It's a bit basic, but certainly better than resting outside!
There are plenty of beds here. It's a bit basic, but certainly better than resting outside!
Help some local farmers with their daily work. Earn some bucks and build your muscles. Though the work is hard and also quite a bit boring.
